aboutText: The PMI Research Achievement Award recognizes and honors an individual whose work has significantly advanced the concepts, knowledge, and practices of project management through a published body of academic research.
subtitle: Linköping University, Sweden, and BI Norwegian Business School, Norway
description: As a Professor of Strategy and Organization at Linköping University, Jonas Söderlund's extensive contributions to the field of project management are unparalleled. With over 80 papers in top-tier journals and ten books to his name, his research spans diverse areas, including project history, innovation, and project-based work. He has pioneered interdisciplinary approaches, bridging project studies with innovation studies, and played a crucial role in promoting project management in various academic communities worldwide. Söderlund's enduring impact on project management theory, education, and practice makes him a deserving recipient of this prestigious award.
